page.title: 18Prestwood Hist. Comparisons
page.content: There is more variety in first names of 1985 than there was in 1881. Spellings of girls names varies more than boys in both groups. Families in 1985 are much smaller than those of 1881. In 1881 the largest household was at the Vicarage. Our School Log book of 1892 records that a boy was locked in a cupboard for the whole day without food for "insubordination". The last time a cane was used at P.M.S. was in 1962. Punishment today is usually extra work or loss of playtime or a telling off. School attendance in the 1890's and early 1900's was very low during harvest time as the children worked in the fields. Most children were working by the time they were 13. A few became Monitors at the school. In our area girls were often Straw plaiters, and boys worked on the land. A few boys were apprenticed to Master craftsmen.
